subject: p14851532
History: Year old man with sepsis, likely cholangitis, CHF, with worsening O2 requirement from baseline, tubes/lines, worsening edema, acute intrapulm process tubes/lines, worsening edema, acute intrapulm process.
Impression: As compared to, the lung volumes have slightly decreased. The multiple pre-existing parenchymal opacities, notably at the right lung base and in the left perihilar areas, are constant in extent and severity. Moderate cardiomegaly. Mild elongation of the descending aorta. No overt pulmonary edema. No pleural effusions. The right internal jugular vein catheter continues to be in correct position.
